summary:
The Security Council,

Adopted resolution 1986 (2011) on 13 June 2011, 

Welcoming reports of the Secretary-General on UN operation in Cyprus and his mission of good offices,

Noting the need to extend UNFICYP's mandate beyond 15 June 2011,

Reaffirming the primary role of the UN in assisting parties to reach a comprehensive and durable settlement,

Echoing the Secretary-General's view that the Cypriots themselves are responsible for finding a solution,

Welcoming progress in negotiations and leaders' joint statements,

Expressing concern at the slow pace of progress, urging leaders to increase momentum, 

Emphasizing the importance of parties engaging fully, flexibly and constructively,

Welcoming Secretary-General's efforts to stimulate progress, 

Noting need to advance military confidence building measures,

Reaffirming importance of Green Line crossings, 

Convinced of benefits of a comprehensive and durable Cyprus settlement,

Urging leaders to foster positive public rhetoric and explain benefits of settlement,

Highlighting the supportive role of the international community,

Taking note of the stable security situation,

Recalling the 1989 aide memoire,

Noting with regret withholding of access to minefields,

Welcoming Committee on Missing Persons' progress,

Agreeing on the essential role of civil society,

Stressing the need for a rigorous approach to peacekeeping deployments,

Welcoming Secretary-General's intention to review peacekeeping operations.
